text: Is there a way to make the default HubSpot video module GPDR compliant? Did some quick testing and YouTube videos get embedded and displayed no matter the consent status.

Hello!
So for a while my developer account has shown a notice about the changes in HubSpot video and today I saw that my Vidyard videos were copied to HubSpot Video 2.0.
However, there's been nothing about that in my client's account.
Does anybody know if this is something that is being rolled out to developer accounts first?
We have several customn modules that could be affected by this change so I'm worried that they might just suddenly stop working.

When connecting to the visitor identification endpoint for integration with conversations, is it possible to send other variables  (such as role, status, title, etc) from the external website that the chat is loading on, to huspot to save with the user's account? I've tried something similar to this, but it was unsuccessful:
```curl --request POST \
  --url '<https://api.HubSpot.com/conversations/v3/visitor-identification/tokens/create?hapikey=YOUR_HubSpot_API_KEY>' \
--data '{
  "email": "<mailto:gob@bluth.com|gob@bluth.com>",
  "firstName": "Gob",
  "lastName": "Bluth",
  "role": "member",
}'```
I've also tried adding a variable in to the javascript... same thing, wsod.
```    window.hsConversationsSettings = {
      loadImmediately: false,
      enableWidgetCookieBanner: false,
      disableAttachment: true,
      {% if HubSpot_token is not empty %}
      identificationEmail: '{{ user_email }}',
      identificationToken: '{{ HubSpot_token }}',
      role: 'member',
      {% endif %}
    };```
Is that even possible? Maybe I'm missing something?
is there an html link equivalent of a Decline cookies button? Need to provide link in a general cookies document

for a cookie approval/decline button JavaScript always needs to be involved. I mean you could technically make the decline button just be a checkbox input and use CSS to hide the whole thing when checked but it’s probably best to just use JavaScript.

HubSpot provides a Cookie Banner you can use.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/cookie-banner>

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/customize-your-cookie-tracking-settings-and-privacy-policy-alert?_ga=2.33904674.2098467980.1643033113-2097454131.1630795739&_gac=1.90819944.1642546920.CjwKCAiA55mPBhBOEiwANmzoQuR07qxrSiwrYwpv2ZJRDm6rZvdhegWNLCR6Ibc9w_BKbll7wFlMMxoCPPwQAvD_BwE|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/customize-your-cookie-tracking-settings-and-priva[…]iwrYwpv2ZJRDm6rZvdhegWNLCR6Ibc9w_BKbll7wFlMMxoCPPwQAvD_BwE>
